snippet: Consumer borrowing rose $13.7 billion in January after an even larger $15.9 billion rise in December, the Federal Reserve reported on Friday.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports that consumer borrowing rose $13.7 billion in January 2014 after even larger $15.9 billion rise in December 2013, fueled largely by increases in category that includes auto and student loans.
lead_paragraph: Consumer borrowing rose $13.7 billion in January after an even larger $15.9 billion rise in December, the Federal Reserve reported on Friday.

headline.main: Borrowing Rises for Autos and Student Loans
headline.print_headline: Borrowing Rises for Autos and Student Loans
